channel.title: How to get started in Scrypto
channel.description:
A lot of developers are asking about how to get started in Scrypto. On this post, I am giving guidelines to help you become the Scrypto expert you want to become.
## Should I know Rust before starting ? This is a question we get a lot. Knowing the basics of Rust's syntax will make it easier for you to understand and write Scrypto code, but you don't need to be an expert in Rust. We suggest people new to Rust to read [A half-hour to learn Rust](https://fasterthanli.me/articles/a-half-hour-to-learn-rust). This quick tutorial will teach just about anyone with a little programming experience enough of the Rust basics to start building with Scrypto quickly.
## From zero to expert 1. Read the [Scrypto documentation](https://docs.radixdlt.com/main/scrypto/introduction.html) and try the concepts you learn in the [Scrypto Playground](https://play.scrypto-lang.org/) 2. Install Rust and the Scrypto simulator by following [these instructions](https://docs.radixdlt.com/main/scrypto/getting-started/install-scrypto.html) 3. Look at Scrypto examples in the [community-scrypto](https://github.com/radixdlt/community-scrypto-examples) GitHub repository 4. Make your own example and create a pull request to that same repository. This will allow you to get feedback from RDX Works 5. Participate in the discussions on the Scrypto [Discord](https://discord.gg/tfw6vhY32n) and [Telegram](t.me/RadixDevelopers) channels
After that, it's only a matter of coding, coding, and more coding. After writing a couple of examples, you will become good enough in Scrypto to make your own project and help people in the community !
